completedCompanyActions.description:
The sustainability clause should be integrated into both term sheets and shareholder agreements. As a result, companies commit to measuring their CO₂ emissions and to actively work on reducing them. 

After a deal is closed, you should propose a startup to join LFCA and piblicly commit to our Green Pledge. This way we can support them in their transformation. There are no penalties defined in the clause and therefore it is important to motivate the founders to do so.

requirements.description:
You can find the text of the clause [here](https://res.cloudinary.com/dhpk1grmy/raw/upload/v1605174399/Content/ESG_Clause___Sustainability_Clause_2.0_v2_dicnpa.docx).
In case the founders or other participating VCs want to adjust or remove the clause during the negotiations, this is of course possible.

requirements.description:
One of the projects where you can find cleaning products and soap without microplastic: [Zero Waste Era](https://www.zerowasteera.com)

Mark this action as completed if you will buy only eco-friendly cleaning products and soap for your office from now on.
requirements.title: Conscious office cleaning: eco-friendly cleaning products, minimal bins and plastic bags

requirements.description:
Mark this action as completed if you will buy office supplies made from recycled materials, produced and delivered in an eco-friendly way from now on. 

Recycled paper is 100% made from used paper, saving resources and water. Although the recycled paper is no longer pure white, it is also free of peroxides, sodium carbonate, and sodium hydroxide. These chemicals are used both in the production of fresh fibre paper and for bleaching paper. Recycled paper has two to three times lower energy consumption during production. 

At [Memo](http://www.memo.de), [EarthHero](https://earthhero.com/product-category/home/office-supplies/), or [GreenPicks](https://www.greenpicks.de/en/office-supplies-stationery/) you can find all of your sustainable office supplies.
requirements.title: Eco-friendly office supplies: paper, post-its, pens, business cards, etc.

requirements.description:
Our aim here is to minimize the delivery footprint and support local businesses.
Only purchase food and drinks with verified environmental standards.
requirements.title: Responsible food and drink: local, organic, seasonal

requirements.description:
Here are some ideas on how to make your marketing materials more eco-friendly:
- at conferences, fairs, and festivals, consider digital ways to interact with potential customers: screens, VR & AR, QR-codes, projections, e-business cards, and catalogs, etc.
- if you do choose to produce some giveaways, opt for materials with less of an end-of-life process
- order production locally to avoid causing additional emissions through deliveries
- improve your planning process to minimize waste after events.
requirements.title: Minimal giveaways: t-shirts, flyers, stickers, etc.

requirements.description:
What you can do:
- encourage your colleagues to order food delivery less: organize lunch in your office, subsidize lunch in the nearest cafes, or arrange food delivery in reusable containers,
- make sure you use glasses in your office and wash them instead of one-use plastic cups,
- buy beverages in returnable glass bottles,
- buy office snacks in bigger packages with less plastic.
requirements.title: Minimal plastic waste: no plastic cups and bottles, reduced food delivery waste

requirements.description:
What you can do to print less:
- implement electronic signature systems where possible
- instead of printing reports before business meetings, use more screens in meeting rooms
- decrease the amount of pages by reducing font or page border sizes of regularly printed documents: contracts, agreements, etc.
- add a reminder to print less in your corporate signatures
- as a default setting, double-sided printing in black and white is recommended.

Plus, you can recycle your printer cartridges using a free recycling box from [Caritas](https://www.caritas.de/spendeundengagement/andershelfen/caritasbox/caritasboxstartseite).
requirements.title: Minimal printing policy

requirements.description:
These purchases can influence your carbon footprint significantly. 
- implement a repair-first policy: it's better to fix a laptop than buy a new one
- regularly calculate and check the footprint created by your equipment purchases (some companies, such as [Apple](https://www.apple.com/environment/pdf/products/notebooks/13-inch_MacBookPro_PER_may2019.pdf) and [Dell](https://i.dell.com/sites/csdocuments/CorpComm_Docs/en/carbon-footprint-latitude-7490.pdf), share data about their products’ footprint on their websites)
- when you need to buy things for your new office, don't just pay attention to them being made of ‘natural’ materials, but also to their production footprint
- utilize old and broken equipment in specially designated places.
requirements.title: Responsible use of office equipment and furniture

requirements.description:
Make sure that:
- you have a company-wide recovery and recycling program that includes: paper, cardboard, plastic, glass, metal, and composting
- you recycle waste not only from the kitchen but also all papers in your working spaces, cartons at your warehouse, etc.
- your utility service works with all types of waste after you separate it, so it goes into the correct waste sorting centers.
requirements.title: Proper waste separation system

requirements.description:
Install low-flow faucets, toilets, and urinals in your office. 
Low-flow should meet or exceed the following EPA WaterSense standards: faucets use a maximum of [1.5 gpm](http://www.epa.gov/WaterSense/products/bathroom_sink_faucets.html), toilets - [max 1.28 gallons per flush](http://www.epa.gov/WaterSense/products/toilets.html).
requirements.title: Water conservation

completedCompanyActions.title: Apply sustainability principles in your office

completedCompanyActions.description: Cutting down on your flights and moving towards train travel has a significant impact on your carbon footprint.

requirements.description:
For domestic routes under five hours by train, take the train.
Railway stations are often more centrally located than airports, which makes arrival and departure easier and reduces the footprint of using taxis.  

Mark this action as completed as soon as you change your corporate travel policy accordingly.
requirements.title: Trains over planes policy

requirements.description:
For intercontinental travel, a seat in business class produces __two to three times__ as much CO2 as an economy seat. 
First-class seats even produce up to __six times__ as much CO2.

Mark this action as completed as soon as you change your corporate travel policy and make sure that you buy only economy class tickets from now on.
requirements.title: Economy class flights only
